text.name: rt_policy_description_croprotation
text.text: Requires rotating crops between fields and seasons to maintain soil fertility, break pest and disease cycles, improve nutrient balance, and protect long term yields.

text.name: rt_policy_description_sprayviolation
text.text: Prohibits spraying chemicals (Solid Fertilizer, Slurry, Lime, Manure, Herbicide) within 14m buffer zones of water bodies to prevent runoff and contamination that can harm aquatic life, degrade water quality, and endanger human health. Violations are penalized.

text.name: rt_policy_description_empty_food
text.text: Requires animals to always have sufficient feed available; keep feed troughs topped up and accessible at all times to prevent hunger and meet welfare standards.

text.name: rt_policy_description_empty_straw
text.text: Requires animals to be provided with adequate straw bedding to ensure comfort, insulation and hygiene. Straw reduces injury and stress, helps maintain body temperature, and absorbs moisture to protect animal welfare.

text.name: rt_policy_description_full_slurry
text.text: Requires slurry tanks to be kept below capacity to prevent overflows and spills. Overflows can release slurry into fields and waterways, contaminating soil and water and causing environmental harm.

text.name: rt_policy_description_animal_productivity
text.text: Encourages maintaining animal productivity, which is a general indicator of good animal welfare.

text.name: rt_policy_description_animal_space
text.text: Requires animals to have enough space to move, rest and access food and water; preventing overcrowding reduces stress, injuries and disease spread. Does not apply if a husbandry only has one animal. Younger animals require less space than adults.

text.name: rt_policy_description_manure_spreading
text.text: You should not let manure sit idle indefinitely. Ensure you do not store more than 50% of the manure you produce in a 6 month period. If you do not produce manure you will not be affected by this policy. The report will update monthly, however full evaluation and payout or fines will occur in May and November.

text.name: rt_policy_description_restricted_slurry
text.text: You are not allowed to apply slurry during the months of September to December. You will be penalized for each violation.

text.name: rt_policy_description_sustainable_forestry
text.text: Encourages sustainable forestry practices, rewarding net positive tree planting and fining for overall deforestation. The policy applies to your own land. Doing contract work will not affect your evaluation. The report will update monthly with bi-annual totals, however full evaluation and payout or fines will occur in June and December.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_croprotation
text.text: The report shows totals for compliant and non-compliant land.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_sprayviolation
text.text: The report shows how many spraying violations occurred in the last month.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_empty_food
text.text: The report shows how many combined hours food was empty in animal pens.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_empty_straw
text.text: The report shows how many combined hours straw was empty in animal pens.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_full_slurry
text.text: The report shows how many combined hours slurry tanks were full.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_animal_productivity
text.text: The report shows how many combined hours animals were unproductive.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_animal_space
text.text: The report shows first how many violation hours were recorded. Then for each husbandry it shows the available space and the highest required space in the previous month.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_manure_spreading
text.text: The report shows the amount of manure produced over the last 6 months. It also shows total produced and maximum allowed storage over the last 6 months. Note that Month 1 data shown will not be included in the next report, and any manure produced in the current month will need to be accounted for.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_restricted_slurry
text.text: The report shows how many times slurry was applied during the restricted months.

text.name: rt_policy_report_description_sustainable_forestry
text.text: The report shows how many trees were planted and cut down in the current bi-annual period.

text.name: rt_report_value_not_enough_months_elapsed
text.text: Full evaluation was skipped this month.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_delayed_mowing
text.text: Do not cut your grass during the spring months (March to June) to protect wildlife. In July, you will be compensated for any uncut grass.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_crop_promotion
text.text: A government initiative to promote the growth of %s through financial incentives. You may be provided equipment for the duration of the initiative and receive a financial bonus for each field where you plant the crop.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_reduce_bale_wrapping
text.text: Wrapping bales consumes plastic and prevents the spread of seeds during transportation. This scheme does not punish you for wrapping bales - it only rewards you when you choose an alternative such as making hay bales or using a forage wagon.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_tractor_demo
text.text: %s are offering your farm the opportunity to demo a %s for %s month%s. The exact specification of the demo vehicle is determined at the point that you sign up to the scheme.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_natural_grazing
text.text: A scheme to encourage letting animals graze in a pasture without additional feed. The payment is intended to offset any loss of earnings. You will receive a bonus for the time that your animals spend grazing in a pasture. The bonus amount is variable depending on the type of animal.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_natural_fertiliser
text.text: A scheme to encourage the use of natural fertilisers such as manure, slurry, and digestate. You will receive a bonus for the amount of natural fertiliser you use compared to synthetic alternatives. This applies to all fertiliser you spread, whether it is on your farm or for a contract.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_winter_cover_crops
text.text: Encourages the planting of cover crops during the winter months to reduce soil erosion and nutrient leaching. You will receive a bonus for each field where you plant an approved cover crop during the winter season.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_road_snow_clearing
text.text: In light of recent snowfall, the local council are asking farmers to spread salt to help keep the roads clear and safe. Ensure that when spreading your speed remains no higher than %s%s to ensure adequate coverage.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_brand_demo
text.text: %s are offering your farm the opportunity to demo some equipment for %s month%s. The exact specification of the demo vehicle is determined at the point that you sign up to the scheme.

text.name: rt_scheme_desc_set_aside
text.text: Encourages setting aside a portion of your farmland, providing a rest from constant work. You will receive a bonus for land left clear of crops for at least %d months leading up to December. If over %s qualify, all crops sold in the following tax year will qualify for a 5%% tax rate.

text.name: rt_scheme_report_desc_crop_promotion

text.name: rt_scheme_report_desc_reduce_bale_wrapping

text.name: rt_scheme_report_desc_natural_grazing

text.name: rt_scheme_report_desc_natural_fertiliser
text.text: The report shows the usage of natural and other fertilizers during the last month.

text.name: rt_scheme_report_desc_winter_cover_crops
text.text: The report shows a list of farmlands and the amount paid out during the last evaluation.

text.name: rt_scheme_report_desc_road_snow_clearing
text.text: There is no report for this scheme. Once the snow ends, you will receive a payout relative to how much salt you have spread.

text.name: rt_scheme_report_desc_set_aside
text.text: The report shows the payout for each of your fields. It also shows if you have qualified for the special 5% tax rate.

text.name: rt_help_intro_intro
text.text: Red Tape is a mod that introduces Policies, Schemes, and Taxation to Farming Simulator. These systems are designed to add depth and challenge to your farming experience, encouraging sustainable practices and strategic planning.

text.name: rt_help_intro_intro_2
text.text: All information relating to Red Tape is contained in the new menu added to the main menu. Look for the government building icon.

text.name: rt_help_policies_intro
text.text: Policies are essentially laws that you must comply with when farming. They govern things such as how you treat animals and appropriate use of land.

text.name: rt_help_policies_intro_2
text.text: In the Policies tab you will see a list of policies. Select each to see the description of how to comply. Further down you will see a report on how you have performed. Some policies check every month, while others check less frequently. Most of the time, a policy will produce a report every month so you can track your progress.

text.name: rt_help_policies_intro_3
text.text: If you comply with a policy, you will earn points which contribute to your compliance tier. Higher compliance tiers lead to benefits such as improved Scheme rewards and possibly tax breaks. If you violate a policy, you may receive warnings or fines depending on the severity of the violation. Where you have received a warning, an icon will appear next to the policy name and you will receive a notification in game. Address the problem to avoid a future fine.

text.name: rt_help_schemes_intro
text.text: Schemes are optional and become available throughout the year. You can sign up to any that you wish to. Typically Schemes require you to do certain things to qualify and receive proportionate benefits. Like Policies, reports are generated to explain your performance. All rewards scale according to your Economic Difficulty Setting.

text.name: rt_help_schemes_intro_2
text.text: Schemes might also be situational, such as a brand running a demo where you can use equipment for a time at no cost. In all cases, your compliance tier for Policies directly affects the Scheme rewards available to you. Tier D schemes give the lowest rewards, while Tier A schemes give the greatest rewards.

text.name: rt_help_schemes_intro_3
text.text: Schemes typically run for a set period of time, often a year or a number of evaluations. Schemes will become available again in time, but you must sign up again if you wish to. Some Schemes have a limited window in which they are available. For example, the Crop Promotion scheme is only available in the first few months of the year.

text.name: rt_help_tax_intro
text.text: Tax is a system that gives a portion of your profits to the government. A tax statement is finalised in April each year, and you will automatically pay the tax due in September. If you don't have enough money to pay the tax bill, your balance will go negative.

text.name: rt_help_tax_intro_2
text.text: In the Tax tab, you can see a finalised statement in the left side of the view. On the right hand side you can see running totals for your current financial year. You can use this to plan ahead and reduce your tax bill. For example if you see your profits are high for the year, you might choose to purchase new equipment to reduce profit, and therefore your tax.

text.name: rt_help_tax_intro_3
text.text: Sometimes you will see Tax Notes. These tell you when your tax statement is modified by some non-standard condition. For example, a Scheme might offer you a future tax break. This will be indicated in Tax Notes to help you understand your bill.
